title: The GR 20
description: Considered to be the most difficult of all trails in Europe, the GR 20 is a footpath that traverses the Mediterranean island of Corsica from north to south along its spiny mountainous backbone.

Known locally as Fra Li Monti (Corsican for 'across the mountains'), it covers a distance of %distance% and between the northern starting point at Calenzana to the finish at Conca in the south, there are hidden mountain lakes, expansive sea views, rugged and rocky cliffs, and remarkable panoramas.
